channel.title: Why did you start making music?
channel.description: I’ve been in a crisis lately, I’ve found it hard for myself to discuss topics like this but I just had to ask really. What motivates you to make combinations of sounds to impress those around you? Or what motivates you to make it for yourself?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: GrandpaMusic
item.description:
I started making my own music after I learned to use GarageBand when I remade a bunch of Eiffel 65 songs. My first song was an idea I’d been thinking about a lot. I wrote it, recorded it, and released it. That was over three years ago. Since then, I’ve been making songs as they formulate.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: neven6757
item.description:
I never really intended to make music in the first place, i found Auxy and tried it out a little and ended up making a song that was actually not that bad, so i kept going from there and ended up to now making 30+ songs that im really proud of.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: Plhector
item.description:
After reading this, I completely agree. I find that whenever I mess around with something such as distortion on any instrument, it all sounds pretty much the same. The automation screen you were talking about has been bothering me so much! I use a lot of automation and now I feel like I’m stuck.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
I have no idea if you read my post in another thread, I go into more detail on why I stopped using Auxy.

Auxy Community: Thoughts/ Auxy vs. Other Music Production Apps Random
Honestly, I’ve talked about A6 within the Auxy Collective Discord and through Disco for far too many times, it’s a real chore that I have to keep venting my frustrations with it. First of all, the update would’ve been great if my old projects weren’t completely F()()()ed by the new sounds. Little did I know, the new sounds don’t sound nearly the same as they used to back in Auxy 5. I’ve talked to other people within The Auxy Collective discord about my situation and they had the same problems …

It’s a lengthy read, but how else can I condence something so large like this update?

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.dc:creator: Plhector
item.description:
Yeah I find myself having the same problems. The sound design was just more accessible before Auxy 6. I haven’t used Auxy since the update. I’ve been regretting updating Auxy.

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
I started making music because the programs I’ve used were accessible, which is still unfortunately true to this day. Recently, ever since the update, I’ve been quickly losing intrest in making music because there were too many changes happening at the same time, I was eventually lost and couldn’t make music without screwing up new and old projects.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: SbstntlySbstndrd

Unrelated: I’m new. I know where to post my tracks but not how. Heh…

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: Akyut
item.description:
It’s the best outlet I have. Whether it be for stress, anger, love, or happiness, emotion is what drives me to produce.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: Katki
item.description:
When I was younger I had this thought: "what if the melodies in my head could be turned into actual songs…"
I had already been using GarageBand since ever since I had been able to tap buttons, but I didn’t feel like I was really making music. (This was because I only used loops provided by GarageBand) Then one day (like last summer) I found Auxy.
I think like a lot of people on Auxy, music is an outlet to express all the frustrating feelings you have inside. I want someone to listen to my music and feel understood…If that makes any sense.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: Dj_Peloton
item.description:
The reason I started making music on auxy was because for a while I had been making piano compositions and I wanted to expand on what I worked on, I stumbled upon the old green app for iPad and then found it on phone, and here I am!

Read full topic

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: VJM
item.description:
You’re right. There’s variety in music too. It doesn’t have to be so rigid, strict. It’s cool to change it up in the second verse. An extra snare will add a nice touch. A few FX here and there don’t have a pattern of frequencies, but they sound good nonetheless, if done correctly.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: BobTheGUYYYYY
item.description:
Alternate reason: BECAUSE MUSIC IS AWESOME

Alternate alternate reason: because none of the other music is good enough for my standards

Alternate alternate alternate reason: Because there’s dubstep stuck in my head and I NEED TO GET IT OUT

Alternate alternate alternate alternate reason: Well I like this song but there’s this one part that I would change…

Alternate alternate alternate alternate alternate reason: I wanna be like that guy

Read full topic

item.description:
That’s right. Done correctly math is always accurate, and music is made up of math and numbers. Half steps whole steps. Time signature. Repeating patterns. Every sound has its own set of frequencies.

item.source: Why did you start making music?

item.title: Why did you start making music?
item.dc:creator: tictacto
item.description:
I’ve been involved in music since 4th grade, and even before that i was a pretty musical kid.

I guess after a few years I thought I’d try my hand at a new kind. Strangely enough, that’s around the time Auxy 1.0 was released

I was enthralled, and starting using it right away. That being said, I wasn’t particularly good with music, but I had my fun nonetheless!

Now I make music to make others feel just that but happier, and that’s probably why all my songs are upbeat haha

No matter the reason, you should try to have fun with your music ^^

Read full topic
item.source: Why did you start making music?
